quotes.author: Billy J Conor Walton
quotes.body: Before you judge a man, walk a mile in his shoes. After that who cares?... He’s a mile away and you’ve got his shoes!

quotes.author: Ken K. Thompson
quotes.body: When in doubt, use brute force.

quotes.author: Donald Knuth
quotes.body: We should forget about small efficiencies, say about 97% of the time: premature optimization is the root of all evil. Yet we should not pass up our opportunities in that critical 3%.

quotes.author: Fred Brooks
quotes.body: What one programmer can do in one month, two programmers can do in two months.

quotes.author: Poul Anderson
quotes.body: I have yet to see any problem, however complicated, which when looked at in the right way, did not become more complicated.

quotes.author: Brian Kernighan
quotes.body: Debugging is twice as hard as writing the code in the first place. Therefore, if you write the code as cleverly as possible, you are, by definition, not smart enough to debug it.

quotes.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra
quotes.body: Testing can be a very effective way to show the presence of bugs, but it is hopelessly inadequate for showing their absence.

quotes.author: Henri Petroski
quotes.body: The most amazing achievement of the computer software industry is its continuing cancellation of the steady and staggering gains made by the computer hardware industry.

quotes.author: Linus Torvalds
quotes.body: I'm doing a free operating system (just a hobby, won't be big and professional like GNU).
